alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 12:52AM MST until September 01 at 4:00AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 400 AM MST. * At 1252 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing very heavy rain nearing the Interstate 40 and Highway 93 interchange east of Kingman. The thunderstorms will continue to move north eventually impacting Valentine and Peach Springs. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Valentine, Diamond M Ranch, Diamond Creek Campground, Blake Ranch Road and Peach Springs. This includes the following roads... Highway 93 in Mohave County between mile markers 92 and 94. Interstate 40 in Arizona between mile markers 66 and 93. Route 66 between mile markers 77 and 109. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
